item.title: TranquilScape (Server Project)
item.dc:creator: @Jim1 Jim_
item.description:
@Jim1 wrote:

LeScape:

One little stereotype of moparscapers is that we all want to make the best server (which is true), so we make developement teams that just crash (also true)…and I wish that second one wasn’t true.

It happens time and time again… For example, when I was hiring (I’ll call them people, nothing more) people for a development team for ReenScape, I had tons of people apply but only 3-4 of them new how to program.

Yet, weeks into the development only one person really knew what they were doing, the other 2-3 hadn’t even contributed or they claimed to “have gotten lives”.

Regardless of what they chose to do, a team that initially starts off large is actually quite incomplete. Though you may think “Oh, I have a web developer.” when they never help you at all.

My suggestion to you is this:

Start off small, build up a server your self and figure out what you want in the server. Then, after customizing it with the initial things you want consider hiring a team.

There is no point in hiring a team when you have no idea what you want. From the looks of your post your in that exact situation.

LeScape, another stereotype and also fact, is that every single server is the same. This makes the “competition” for making the best server impossible since servers are almost always released and new servers born therein.

Read full topic

item.title: TranquilScape (Server Project)
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

[quote=“akanaz, post:9, topic:193085”]I’m just saying it’s a bit dumb to have mod and admin apps when you don’t know who they could be, they could act nice, but imagine how mnay members are here just to get admin, afterall, isn’t it what every noob constantly wants, we both know you go on a server as owner and you will be asked to give a random player admin or mod multiple times in an hour. Sorry i shouldn’t have reacted this way, it just really annoys me when people post with mod and admin.

Sorry, And thanx for not being as big a dick as me

Oh and you can code better zubmage?

The only reason i thought he’d just started out is because i misinterpreted one of his previous comments when he said “i just started” i htought he meant coding so i was telling him it wouldn’t be wise to start a dev team if you’ve started coding as you will need security against leechers. Sorry to u 2 though, no i’m no master coder but i am satisfactory :P.

Sorry both of you for my stupid attitude which didb’t help the situation at all, not to mention it was unprovoked.[/quote]

Extremely well thought out point there. I also thought that you were acting on the impression that he had only started coding, not his development team.

And yes, Tranquill you shouldn’t hire moderators and administrators at this stage. All you need is:
A forum coder
A coder

Read full topic
